name: Domestic R&D paid for by the company and performed by the company and others as a percentage of domestic net sales, by industry and company size: 2016
description: Domestic R&D paid for by the company and performed by the company and others as a percentage of domestic net sales, by industry and company size: 2016

creator.name: National Center for Science and Engineering Statistics

variableMeasured.name: field_domestic_r_d_us_millions_
variableMeasured.unitText: Millions of U.S. dollars and percent)

variableMeasured.name: field_percent_of_domestic_sales_of_r_d_performers_or_fundersa
variableMeasured.description: Percent Of Domestic Sales Of R D Performers Or Fundersa
variableMeasured.unitText: Millions of U.S. dollars and percent)

variableMeasured.name: field_percent_of_domestic_sales_of_r_d_performersb
variableMeasured.description: Percent Of Domestic Sales Of R D Performersb
variableMeasured.unitText: Millions of U.S. dollars and percent)

specialValues.D: suppressed to avoid disclosure of confidential information

notes: Detail may not add to total because of rounding. Industry classification is based on the dominant business code for domestic R&D performance, where available. For companies that did not report business codes, the classification used for sampling was assigned. Statistics are representative of companies located in the United States that performed or funded R&D, unless indicated otherwise.
sources: National Science Foundation, National Center for Science and Engineering Statistics, and U.S. Census Bureau, Business R&D and Innovation Survey, 2016.
